message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for $9500. It's a great deal, and I think you'll love it!
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. I'm really interested in the product, but I'm on a tight budget. Can you meet me at this price?

I understand that you're on a tight budget, Bob, but I'm not sure I can meet you at $8000. How about we meet in the middle at $9000? I'm willing to make a compromise, but I need to make a profit on this sale.
I'm still a bit far from my budget, but I'm willing to meet you at $8500. Can you consider this price?

I can see you're really interested in the product, Bob, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you at $9200, which is a bit higher than your last offer. I think it's a fair price considering the product's value to you.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Can we try $8800? I'm really interested in the product, and I think we can find a mutually beneficial price.

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. I can see you're really interested in the product, and I want to make a deal happen. How about we meet at $9500 again, but I'll throw in some extras to sweeten the deal?
I appreciate the extras, but I'm still not willing to go up to $9500. I'm willing to meet you at $8900. Can we finalize the deal at this price?

I'm not willing to go all the way down to $8900, Bob. I think I've already compromised enough. I'm willing to meet you at $9300, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.
I'm not willing to go any higher than $8800. This is my final offer. I'm really interested in the product, but I need to stay within my budget. Can you meet me at this price?
